titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn newsletter collection ARC.174
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T10:43-0500

did.abstract: The Brooklyn newsletter collection, dated 1869 to 2004 (bulk 1960 to 2000) and measuring 2.0 linear feet, contains periodicals published in Brooklyn, as well as publications from Brooklyn-based businesses and social groups.
did.langmaterial: Materials in English, with issues of the Brooklyn Berichten in German.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for items in the collection are unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn newsletter collection, ARC.174, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn newsletter collection, dated 1869 to 2004 (bulk 1960 to 2000) and measuring 2.0 linear feet, contains periodicals published in Brooklyn, as well as publications from Brooklyn-based businesses and social groups.
The following publications are contained in the collection:

p.emph: About Town: Weekly Notes of Brooklyn

scopecontent.p: Ascent Institute: Ascent
Bargemusic: Bargemusic Calendar
Better Brooklyn Committee and the Brooklyn Hall of Fame: Brooklyn Review
Boro Park Historical Society
Brooklyn Borough Hall: Brooklyn Newsletter
Brooklyn Center for the Urban Environment and Prospect Park Environmental Center: CityGreen
Brooklyn Economic Development Corporation: BEDC Update
Brooklyn In Touch: Neighborhood News
Brooklyn Library Council: Bulletin of the Brooklyn Library Council
Brooklyn Regional Office, Veterans Administration: Personnel Bulletin
Brooklyn Sports Foundation: Newsletter
Brooklyn Union Gas: Gas Works: Strategies for Saving Energy and Money; Sendout; and Management News.
The Brooklyn Urban League: Herald
Brownstone Billiards
Canarsie Historical Society
Central Brooklyn Model Cities: The Key Hole
Citizens for a Better New York: Environmental Viewpoint
Civic Union
Community Board #9: Community News and Information
The Coney Island Hysterical Society: Inside Coney Island
Coney Island, USA: The Coney Isl-O-Phile
Congregation Beth Elohim: Newsletter
Dignity/Brooklyn: The Bridge
Dodgers Alumni Association: Alumni News
Eastern States Historical Clearing House
East Midwood Jewish Center: Bulletin of the East Midwood Jewish Center
Flatlands Historical Foundation and Flatlands Chamber of Commerce: News from Flatlands
Fulton Ferry Landing Museum
Fulton Mall Improvement Association, Inc.: Fulton Mall News

p.emph: Gaslight Gazette, The Park Slope Neighborhood Guide

Long Island Empire Chapter, Telephone Pioneers of America: The Long Island Pioneer
Lubavitch Youth Organization: L'Chaim: The Weekly Publication for Every Jewish Person
Douglas MacArthur Republican Club: Republican Report

Montauk Theatre
Namm's: The Namm-Ite
Neighborhood Open Space Coalition/Friends of Gateway: Urban Outdoors Review

Parks and Recreation Department/Brooklyn: The Green Machine and Urban Park Rangers.
Prospect Park Environmental Center: CityGreen
Scandinavian East Coast Museum: Nordic News
Securities Industry Automation Corporation: SIAC News
Samuel J. Tilden High School Alumni Association: Tilden Alumni News

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society also holds a photograph collection from Positive Focus; see 2007.041.
